info.title: Merge Ticketing API
info.description: The unified API for building rich integrations with multiple Ticketing platforms.

get.description: Get details for a linked account.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Returns the account token for the end user with the provided public token.
Returns a list of `Account` objects.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created after this datetime.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created before this datetime.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: include_deleted_data
parameters.description: Whether to include data that was marked as deleted by third party webhooks.

parameters.name: include_remote_data
parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge after this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge before this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: remote_id
parameters.description: The API provider's ID for the given object.

get.description: Returns an `Account` object with the given `id`.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: include_remote_data
parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

post.description: Asynchronously pull data from an endpoint not currently supported by Merge.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created after this datetime.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created before this datetime.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Which relations should be returned in expanded form. Multiple relation names should be comma separated without spaces.

parameters.name: include_deleted_data
parameters.description: Whether to include data that was marked as deleted by third party webhooks.

parameters.name: include_remote_data
parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge after this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge before this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: remote_created_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return attachments created in the third party platform after this datetime.

parameters.name: remote_id
parameters.description: The API provider's ID for the given object.

parameters.name: ticket_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only return comments for this ticket.

post.description: Creates an `Attachment` object with the given values.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: is_debug_mode
parameters.description: Whether to include debug fields (such as log file links) in the response.

parameters.name: run_async
parameters.description: Whether or not third-party updates should be run asynchronously.

get.description: Returns an `Attachment` object with the given `id`.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: expand

parameters.name: include_remote_data
parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

get.description: Returns the `File` content with the given `id` as a stream of bytes.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: mime_type
parameters.description: If provided, specifies the export format of the file to be downloaded. For information on supported export formats, please refer to our export format help center article.

get.description: Returns metadata for `TicketingAttachment` POSTs.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Gets a list of audit trail events.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include audit trail events that occurred before this time

parameters.name: event_type
parameters.description: If included, will only include events with the given event type. Possible values include: `CREATED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `DELETED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `CREATED_TEST_API_KEY`, `DELETED_TEST_API_KEY`, `REGENERATED_PRODUCTION_API_KEY`, `INVITED_USER`, `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_ENABLED`, `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_DISABLED`, `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `CREATED_DESTINATION`, `DELETED_DESTINATION`, `CHANGED_DESTINATION`, `CHANGED_SCOPES`, `CHANGED_PERSONAL_INFORMATION`, `CHANGED_ORGANIZATION_SETTINGS`, `ENABLED_INTEGRATION`, `DISABLED_INTEGRATION`, `ENABLED_CATEGORY`, `DISABLED_CATEGORY`, `CHANGED_PASSWORD`, `RESET_PASSWORD`, `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION`, `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION`, `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT`, `CREATED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CREATED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CHANGED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `CHANGED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `DELETED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING`, `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING`, `FORCED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_RESYNC`, `MUTED_ISSUE`, `GENERATED_MAGIC_LINK`, `ENABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK`, `DISABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK`, `MERGE_WEBHOOK_TARGET_CHANGED`

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include audit trail events that occurred after this time

parameters.name: user_email
parameters.description: If provided, this will return events associated with the specified user email. Please note that the email address reflects the user's email at the time of the event, and may not be their current email.

get.description: Returns a list of models and actions available for an account.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Returns a list of `Collection` objects.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: collection_type
parameters.description: If provided, will only return collections of the given type.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created after this datetime.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created before this datetime.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Which relations should be returned in expanded form. Multiple relation names should be comma separated without spaces.

parameters.name: include_deleted_data
parameters.description: Whether to include data that was marked as deleted by third party webhooks.

parameters.name: include_remote_data
parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge after this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge before this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: parent_collection_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only return collections whose parent collection matches the given id.

parameters.name: remote_fields
parameters.description: Deprecated. Use show_enum_origins.

parameters.name: remote_id
parameters.description: The API provider's ID for the given object.

parameters.name: show_enum_origins
parameters.description: A comma separated list of enum field names for which you'd like the original values to be returned, instead of Merge's normalized enum values. [Learn more](https://help.merge.dev/en/articles/8950958-show_enum_origins-query-parameter)

get.description: Returns a `Collection` object with the given `id`.

parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

get.description: Get the default permissions for Merge Common Models and fields across all Linked Accounts of a given category. [Learn more](https://help.merge.dev/en/articles/8828211-common-model-and-field-scopes).

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Get all Field Mappings for this Linked Account. Field Mappings are mappings between third-party Remote Fields and user defined Merge fields. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/supplemental-data/field-mappings/overview/).

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

post.description: Create new Field Mappings that will be available after the next scheduled sync. This will cause the next sync for this Linked Account to sync **ALL** data from start.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

patch.description: Create or update existing Field Mappings for a Linked Account. Changes will be reflected after the next scheduled sync. This will cause the next sync for this Linked Account to sync **ALL** data from start.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

delete.description: Deletes Field Mappings for a Linked Account. All data related to this Field Mapping will be deleted and these changes will be reflected after the next scheduled sync. This will cause the next sync for this Linked Account to sync **ALL** data from start.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Gets all issues for Organization.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include issues whose most recent action occurred before this time

parameters.name: first_incident_time_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return issues whose first incident time was after this datetime.

parameters.name: first_incident_time_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return issues whose first incident time was before this datetime.

parameters.name: include_muted
parameters.description: If true, will include muted issues

parameters.name: last_incident_time_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return issues whose last incident time was after this datetime.

parameters.name: last_incident_time_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return issues whose last incident time was before this datetime.

parameters.name: linked_account_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only include issues pertaining to the linked account passed in.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: If included, will only include issues whose most recent action occurred after this time

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Status of the issue. Options: ('ONGOING', 'RESOLVED')

* `ONGOING` - ONGOING
* `RESOLVED` - RESOLVED

get.description: Get a specific issue.

post.description: Creates a link token to be used when linking a new end user.

get.description: Get all available permissions for Merge Common Models and fields for a single Linked Account. [Learn more](https://help.merge.dev/en/articles/8828211-common-model-and-field-scopes).

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

post.description: Update permissions for any Common Model or field for a single Linked Account. Any Scopes not set in this POST request will inherit the default Scopes. [Learn more](https://help.merge.dev/en/articles/8828211-common-model-and-field-scopes)

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: List linked accounts for your organization.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description:
Options: `accounting`, `ats`, `crm`, `filestorage`, `hris`, `mktg`, `ticketing`

* `hris` - hris
* `ats` - ats
* `accounting` - accounting
* `ticketing` - ticketing
* `crm` - crm
* `mktg` - mktg
* `filestorage` - filestorage
* `datawarehouse` - datawarehouse

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: end_user_email_address
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given email address.

parameters.name: end_user_organization_name
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given organization name.

parameters.name: end_user_origin_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given origin ID.

parameters.name: end_user_origin_ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of EndUser origin IDs, making it possible to specify multiple EndUsers at once.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of LinkedAccount IDs, making it possible to specify multiple LinkedAccounts at once.

parameters.name: include_duplicates
parameters.description: If `true`, will include complete production duplicates of the account specified by the `id` query parameter in the response. `id` must be for a complete production linked account.

parameters.name: integration_name
parameters.description: If provided, will only return linked accounts associated with the given integration name.

parameters.name: is_test_account
parameters.description: If included, will only include test linked accounts. If not included, will only include non-test linked accounts.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status. Options: `COMPLETE`, `INCOMPLETE`, `RELINK_NEEDED`

post.description: Pull data from an endpoint not currently supported by Merge.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

get.description: Get all remote fields for a Linked Account. Remote fields are third-party fields that are accessible after initial sync if remote_data is enabled. You can use remote fields to override existing Merge fields or map a new Merge field. [Learn more](https://docs.merge.dev/supplemental-data/field-mappings/overview/).

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: common_models
parameters.description: A comma seperated list of Common Model names. If included, will only return Remote Fields for those Common Models.

parameters.name: include_example_values
parameters.description: If true, will include example values, where available, for remote fields in the 3rd party platform. These examples come from active data from your customers.

get.description: Get syncing status. Possible values: `DISABLED`, `DONE`, `FAILED`, `PARTIALLY_SYNCED`, `PAUSED`, `SYNCING`. Learn more about sync status in our [Help Center](https://help.merge.dev/en/articles/8184193-merge-sync-statuses).

parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: cursor

post.description: Force re-sync of all models. This is available for all organizations via the dashboard. Force re-sync is also available programmatically via API for monthly, quarterly, and highest sync frequency customers on the Launch, Professional, or Enterprise plans. Doing so will consume a sync credit for the relevant linked account.

get.description: Returns a list of `Ticket` objects.

parameters.name: X-Account-Token
parameters.description: Token identifying the end user.

parameters.name: account_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets for this account.

parameters.name: assignee_ids
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets assigned to the assignee_ids; multiple assignee_ids can be separated by commas.

parameters.name: collection_ids
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets assigned to the collection_ids; multiple collection_ids can be separated by commas.

parameters.name: completed_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets completed after this datetime.

parameters.name: completed_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets completed before this datetime.

parameters.name: contact_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets for this contact.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created after this datetime.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return objects created before this datetime.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The pagination cursor value.

parameters.name: due_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets due after this datetime.

parameters.name: due_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets due before this datetime.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Which relations should be returned in expanded form. Multiple relation names should be comma separated without spaces.

parameters.description: Whether to include the original data Merge fetched from the third-party to produce these models.

parameters.name: include_remote_fields
parameters.description: Whether to include all remote fields, including fields that Merge did not map to common models, in a normalized format.

parameters.name: modified_after
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge after this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: modified_before
parameters.description: If provided, only objects synced by Merge before this date time will be returned.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Number of results to return per page.

parameters.name: parent_ticket_id
parameters.description: If provided, will only return sub tickets of the parent_ticket_id.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description:
If provided, will only return tickets of this priority.

* `URGENT` - URGENT
* `HIGH` - HIGH
* `NORMAL` - NORMAL
* `LOW` - LOW

parameters.name: remote_created_after
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets created in the third party platform after this datetime.

parameters.name: remote_created_before
parameters.description: If provided, will only return tickets created in the third party platform before this datetime.

Account.description:
# The Account Object
### Description
The `Account` object is used to represent the account that a ticket is associated with.

The account is a company that may be a customer. This does not represent the company that is receiving the ticket.

### Usage Example
TODO

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

is_duplicate.description: Whether a Production Linked Account's credentials match another existing Production Linked Account. This field is `null` for Test Linked Accounts, incomplete Production Linked Accounts, and ignored duplicate Production Linked Account sets.

AccountDetailsAndActions.description:
# The LinkedAccount Object
### Description
The `LinkedAccount` object is used to represent an end user's link with a specific integration.

### Usage Example
View a list of your organization's `LinkedAccount` objects.

subdomain.description: The tenant or domain the customer has provided access to.

is_duplicate.description: Whether a Production Linked Account's credentials match another existing Production Linked Account. This field is `null` for Test Linked Accounts, incomplete Production Linked Accounts, and ignored duplicate Production Linked Account sets.

AccountDetailsAndActions.x-merge-sample-json: {"id": "e59b1821-f85c-4e28-a6b3-1804156f3563", "category": "hris", "status": "INCOMPLETE", "status_detail": "Invalid login credentials", "end_user_origin_id": "3ac95cde-6c7f-4eef-afec-be710b42308d", "end_user_organization_name": "Foo Bar, LLC", "end_user_email_address": "hradmin@foobar.dev", "webhook_listener_url": "https://api.merge.dev/api/integrations/webhook-listener/7fc3mee0UW8ecV4", "is_duplicate": true, "integration": {"name": "SAP SuccessFactors", "categories": ["hris", "ats"], "image": "https://cdn.merge.dev/SuccessFactors_Logo.png", "square_image": "https://cdn.merge.dev/SuccessFactors_Square_Logo.jpg", "color": "#F6A704", "slug": "sap-successfactors", "passthrough_available": true, "available_model_operations": [{"model_name": "Candidate", "available_operations": ["FETCH", "CREATE"], "required_post_parameters": ["remote_user_id"], "supported_fields": ["first_name", "last_name", "company", "title"]}]}}

categories.description: Category or categories this integration belongs to. Multiple categories should be comma separated, i.e. [ats, hris].

image.description: Company logo in rectangular shape. Upload an image with a clear background.

square_image.description: Company logo in square shape. Upload an image with a white background.

color.description: The color of this integration used for buttons and text throughout the app and landing pages. Choose a darker, saturated color.

api_endpoints_to_documentation_urls.description: Mapping of API endpoints to documentation urls for support. Example: {'GET': [['/common-model-scopes', 'https://docs.merge.dev/accounting/common-model-scopes/#common_model_scopes_retrieve'],['/common-model-actions', 'https://docs.merge.dev/accounting/common-model-actions/#common_model_actions_retrieve']], 'POST': []}

webhook_setup_guide_url.description: Setup guide URL for third party webhook creation. Exposed in Merge Docs.

category_beta_status.description: Category or categories this integration is in beta status for.

Attachment.description:
# The Attachment Object
### Description
The `Attachment` object is used to represent an attachment for a ticket.

### Usage Example
TODO

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

file_name.description: The attachment's name. It is required to include the file extension in the attachment's name.

ticket.description: The ticket associated with the attachment.

file_url.description: The attachment's url. It is required to include the file extension in the file's URL.

uploaded_by.description: The user who uploaded the attachment.

remote_created_at.description: When the third party's attachment was created.

# The Attachment Object
### Description
The `Attachment` object is used to represent an attachment for a ticket.

### Usage Example
TODO

file_name.description: The attachment's name. It is required to include the file extension in the attachment's name.

ticket.description: The ticket associated with the attachment.

file_url.description: The attachment's url. It is required to include the file extension in the file's URL.

uploaded_by.description: The user who uploaded the attachment.

user_name.description: The User's full name at the time of this Event occurring.

user_email.description: The User's email at the time of this Event occurring.

role.description:
Designates the role of the user (or SYSTEM/API if action not taken by a user) at the time of this Event occurring.

* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

event_type.description:
Designates the type of event that occurred.

* `CREATED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY` - CREATED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY
* `DELETED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY` - DELETED_REMOTE_PRODUCTION_API_KEY
* `CREATED_TEST_API_KEY` - CREATED_TEST_API_KEY
* `DELETED_TEST_API_KEY` - DELETED_TEST_API_KEY
* `REGENERATED_PRODUCTION_API_KEY` - REGENERATED_PRODUCTION_API_KEY
* `INVITED_USER` - INVITED_USER
* `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_ENABLED` - TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_ENABLED
* `TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_DISABLED` - TWO_FACTOR_AUTH_DISABLED
* `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT` - DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT
* `CREATED_DESTINATION` - CREATED_DESTINATION
* `DELETED_DESTINATION` - DELETED_DESTINATION
* `CHANGED_DESTINATION` - CHANGED_DESTINATION
* `CHANGED_SCOPES` - CHANGED_SCOPES
* `CHANGED_PERSONAL_INFORMATION` - CHANGED_PERSONAL_INFORMATION
* `CHANGED_ORGANIZATION_SETTINGS` - CHANGED_ORGANIZATION_SETTINGS
* `ENABLED_INTEGRATION` - ENABLED_INTEGRATION
* `DISABLED_INTEGRATION` - DISABLED_INTEGRATION
* `ENABLED_CATEGORY` - ENABLED_CATEGORY
* `DISABLED_CATEGORY` - DISABLED_CATEGORY
* `CHANGED_PASSWORD` - CHANGED_PASSWORD
* `RESET_PASSWORD` - RESET_PASSWORD
* `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION` - ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION
* `ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT` - ENABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT
* `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION` - DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_ORGANIZATION
* `DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT` - DISABLED_REDACT_UNMAPPED_DATA_FOR_LINKED_ACCOUNT
* `CREATED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING` - CREATED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING
* `CREATED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING` - CREATED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING
* `CHANGED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING` - CHANGED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING
* `CHANGED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING` - CHANGED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING
* `DELETED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING` - DELETED_INTEGRATION_WIDE_FIELD_MAPPING
* `DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING` - DELETED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_FIELD_MAPPING
* `FORCED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_RESYNC` - FORCED_LINKED_ACCOUNT_RESYNC
* `MUTED_ISSUE` - MUTED_ISSUE
* `GENERATED_MAGIC_LINK` - GENERATED_MAGIC_LINK
* `ENABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK` - ENABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK
* `DISABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK` - DISABLED_MERGE_WEBHOOK
* `MERGE_WEBHOOK_TARGET_CHANGED` - MERGE_WEBHOOK_TARGET_CHANGED

AvailableActions.description:
# The AvailableActions Object
### Description
The `Activity` object is used to see all available model/operation combinations for an integration.

### Usage Example
Fetch all the actions available for the `Zenefits` integration.

# The Collection Object
### Description
The `Collection` object is used to represent collections of tickets. Collections may include other collections as
sub collections.

### Usage Example
TODO

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: For tracking all tasks related to Platform for Q1

parent_collection.description: The parent collection for this collection.

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

access_level.description:
The level of access a User has to the Collection and its sub-objects.

* `PRIVATE` - PRIVATE
* `COMPANY` - COMPANY
* `PUBLIC` - PUBLIC

The `Comment` object is used to represent a comment on a ticket.

user.description: The author of the Comment, if the author is a User.

contact.description: The author of the Comment, if the author is a Contact.

body.example: When will these integrations be done? You all should use Merge.

html_body.description: The comment's text body formatted as html.

ticket.description: The ticket associated with the comment.

is_private.description: Whether or not the comment is internal.

target_field_name.description: The name of the target field you want this remote field to map to.

target_field_description.description: The description of the target field you want this remote field to map to.
target_field_description.example: this is a example description of the target field

remote_field_traversal_path.description: The field traversal path of the remote field listed when you hit the GET /remote-fields endpoint.

remote_method.description: The method of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

remote_url_path.description: The path of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

DataPassthroughRequest.description:
# The DataPassthrough Object
### Description
The `DataPassthrough` object is used to send information to an otherwise-unsupported third-party endpoint.

### Usage Example
Create a `DataPassthrough` to get team hierarchies from your Rippling integration.

path.description: The path of the request in the third party's platform.

base_url_override.description: An optional override of the third party's base url for the request.

data.description: The data with the request. You must include a `request_format` parameter matching the data's format

multipart_form_data.description: Pass an array of `MultipartFormField` objects in here instead of using the `data` param if `request_format` is set to `MULTIPART`.

headers.description: The headers to use for the request (Merge will handle the account's authorization headers). `Content-Type` header is required for passthrough. Choose content type corresponding to expected format of receiving server.

normalize_response.description: Optional. If true, the response will always be an object of the form `{"type": T, "value": ...}` where `T` will be one of `string, boolean, number, null, array, object`.

end_user_email_address.description: Your end user's email address. This is purely for identification purposes - setting this value will not cause any emails to be sent.

end_user_origin_id.description: This unique identifier typically represents the ID for your end user in your product's database. This value must be distinct from other Linked Accounts' unique identifiers.

categories.description: The integration categories to show in Merge Link.

integration.description: The slug of a specific pre-selected integration for this linking flow token. For examples of slugs, see https://docs.merge.dev/guides/merge-link/single-integration/.

link_expiry_mins.description: An integer number of minutes between [30, 720 or 10080 if for a Magic Link URL] for how long this token is valid. Defaults to 30.

should_create_magic_link_url.description: Whether to generate a Magic Link URL. Defaults to false. For more information on Magic Link, see https://merge.dev/blog/integrations-fast-say-hello-to-magic-link.

common_models.description: An array of objects to specify the models and fields that will be disabled for a given Linked Account. Each object uses model_id, enabled_actions, and disabled_fields to specify the model, method, and fields that are scoped for a given Linked Account.

category_common_model_scopes.description: When creating a Link Token, you can set permissions for Common Models that will apply to the account that is going to be linked. Any model or field not specified in link token payload will default to existing settings.

language.description: The language code for the language to localize Merge Link to.

integration_specific_config.description: A JSON object containing integration-specific configuration options.

detail.example: custom_fields is a required field on model.

GenerateRemoteKeyRequest.description:
# The GenerateRemoteKey Object
### Description
The `GenerateRemoteKey` object is used to represent a request for a new remote key.

### Usage Example
Post a `GenerateRemoteKey` to create a new remote key.

name.description: The name of the remote key

status.description:
Status of the issue. Options: ('ONGOING', 'RESOLVED')

* `ONGOING` - ONGOING
* `RESOLVED` - RESOLVED

ItemFormatEnum.description:
* `string` - uuid
* `number` - url
* `date` - email
* `datetime` - phone
* `bool` - currency
* `list` - decimal

ItemTypeEnum.description:
* `string` - string
* `number` - number
* `date` - date
* `datetime` - datetime
* `bool` - bool
* `list` - list

common_models.description: The common models you want to update the scopes for

merge_categories.title: Merge Categories
merge_categories.description: Array of Merge's Unified API Categories

new_york_city_neighborhood.title: Borough
new_york_city_neighborhood.description: One of the 5 Boroughs of New York City

favorite_tv_shows.title: Favorite TV Shows
favorite_tv_shows.description: Array of TV Show objects on merge.tv_shows

MethodEnum.description:
* `GET` - GET
* `OPTIONS` - OPTIONS
* `HEAD` - HEAD
* `POST` - POST
* `PUT` - PUT
* `PATCH` - PATCH
* `DELETE` - DELETE

ModelOperation.description:
# The ModelOperation Object
### Description
The `ModelOperation` object is used to represent the operations that are currently supported for a given model.

### Usage Example
View what operations are supported for the `Candidate` endpoint.

MultipartFormFieldRequest.description:
# The MultipartFormField Object
### Description
The `MultipartFormField` object is used to represent fields in an HTTP request using `multipart/form-data`.

### Usage Example
Create a `MultipartFormField` to define a multipart form entry.

name.description: The name of the form field

data.description: The data for the form field.

encoding.description:
The encoding of the value of `data`. Defaults to `RAW` if not defined.

* `RAW` - RAW
* `BASE64` - BASE64
* `GZIP_BASE64` - GZIP_BASE64

file_name.description: The file name of the form field, if the field is for a file.

content_type.description: The MIME type of the file, if the field is for a file.

remote_field_traversal_path.description: The field traversal path of the remote field listed when you hit the GET /remote-fields endpoint.

remote_method.description: The method of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

remote_url_path.description: The path of the remote endpoint where the remote field is coming from.

PatchedTicketRequest.description:
# The Ticket Object
### Description
The `Ticket` object is used to represent a ticket or a task within a system.

### Usage Example
TODO

creator.description: The user who created this ticket.

status.description:
The current status of the ticket.

* `OPEN` - OPEN
* `CLOSED` - CLOSED
* `IN_PROGRESS` - IN_PROGRESS
* `ON_HOLD` - ON_HOLD

description.description: The tickets description. HTML version of description is mapped if supported by the third-party platform.
description.example: Can you please add more integrations? It'll make syncing data much easier!

ticket_type.description: The sub category of the ticket within the 3rd party system. Examples include incident, task, subtask or to-do.

account.description: The account associated with the ticket.

contact.description: The contact associated with the ticket.

ticket_url.description: The 3rd party url of the Ticket.

priority.description:
The priority or urgency of the Ticket.

* `URGENT` - URGENT
* `HIGH` - HIGH
* `NORMAL` - NORMAL
* `LOW` - LOW

Project.description:
# The Project Object
### Description
Please use the `Collection` model. This model will be fully deprecated on 3/30/2024.

### Usage Example
TODO

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

description.example: For tracking all tasks related to Platform for Q1

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

RemoteKey.description:
# The RemoteKey Object
### Description
The `RemoteKey` object is used to represent a request for a new remote key.

### Usage Example
Post a `GenerateRemoteKey` to receive a new `RemoteKey`.

RemoteKeyForRegenerationRequest.description:
# The RemoteKeyForRegeneration Object
### Description
The `RemoteKeyForRegeneration` object is used to exchange an old remote key for a new one

### Usage Example
Post a `RemoteKeyForRegeneration` to swap out an old remote key for a new one

name.description: The name of the remote key

RemoteResponse.description:
# The RemoteResponse Object
### Description
The `RemoteResponse` object is used to represent information returned from a third-party endpoint.

### Usage Example
View the `RemoteResponse` returned from your `DataPassthrough`.

Role.description:
# The Role Object
### Description
The `Role` object is used to represent the set of actions & access that a user with this role is allowed to perform.

### Usage Example
TODO

remote_id.description: The third-party API ID of the matching object.

created_at.description: The datetime that this object was created by Merge.

modified_at.description: The datetime that this object was modified by Merge.

ticket_actions.description: The set of actions that a User with this Role can perform. Possible enum values include: `VIEW`, `CREATE`, `EDIT`, `DELETE`, `CLOSE`, and `ASSIGN`.

ticket_access.description:
The level of Ticket access that a User with this Role can perform.

* `ALL` - ALL
* `ASSIGNED_ONLY` - ASSIGNED_ONLY
* `TEAM_ONLY` - TEAM_ONLY

remote_was_deleted.description: Indicates whether or not this object has been deleted in the third party platform.

RoleEnum.description:
* `ADMIN` - ADMIN
* `DEVELOPER` - DEVELOPER
* `MEMBER` - MEMBER
* `API` - API
* `SYSTEM` - SYSTEM
* `MERGE_TEAM` - MERGE_TEAM

SyncStatus.description:
# The SyncStatus Object
### Description
The `SyncStatus` object is used to represent the syncing state of an account

### Usage Example
View the `SyncStatus` for an account to see how recently its models were synced.

SyncStatusStatusEnum.description:
* `SYNCING` - SYNCING
* `DONE` - DONE
* `FAILED` - FAILED
* `DISABLED` - DISABLED
* `PAUSED` - PAUSED
* `PARTIALLY_SYNCED` - PARTIALLY_SYNCED
